text:
kind of a bummer to see people ragging on a Chinese takeaway joint. decent portions, nice delivery people, same menu yer going
to get just about anywhere, great price, and family-run. this is the kind of place every neighbourhood needs; and all the ding dongs that act as if they signed-on for a Michelin star experience, leaving bad reviews, are the same people that'll lament another plateau restaurant shuttering if it ever comes to that; but here's hoping it won't. keep fighting the good fight CAFE ASIA--- one styrofoam container of sugar-coated fried chicken at a time....

The price is hard to beat here, about 1$ a piece for nigiri, even less for makis.

There is sushi and chinese food, it's obscenely cheap. If you're in the mood for sushi and you're broke come here. The sushi is decent not great but for this price it's very appealing.

The hot and sour soup is pretty good, very surprising. The decor is very kitsch cafeteria circa 1975 and the staff is laid back and nice.

All in all, we ate so much, we were just as full as an ayce sushi  place and we paid 21$ per person taxes and tips included... so yeah I will be back :)

Probably the cheapest sushi in town. Nigiris are a dollar a piece. And most makis are 3-4 pieces for 2-2.5$! Very reasonably priced. The fish is not that fresh but pretty good value for the price you pay! I will definitely come back! The waiter was very nice too.

Le nombre de fois ou j"ai commandé la bas est incalculable..je n'ai mangé que la soupe miso et wonton et les sushis le prix est plus que correcte mais si vous voulez de la qualité il faut payer un peu plus et aller ailleurs

We gotten takeout or delivery several times and we're always pleasantly surprised. It isn't gourmet, or authentic, not by any means, but their Chinese dinners are good value for lots of food. A dinner for 2 can be stretched over several meals for the two of us.  They have a bunch of different combinations and dinners for x combos, and you can also pick individual dishes.  I've never tried their sushi, but I like knowing it's there as an option, in case I get a hankering for a california roll with my general tao.

I like that they have online ordering: food delivered to my door in less than an hour, and I don't even have to talk to a human being other than to say thank you when it's delivered?  Oh yeah!

Nous avions envie de manger de " l'authentique " bouffe chinoise formule livraison, dans le style cliché repas-livré-dans-des-petites-boites-en-carton-fortune-cookie-inclus, et nous sommes tombés sur cette endroit en fouillant sur UberEATS. Nous avons aimé notre expérience dans l'ensemble. La livraison s'est faite rapidement (35 min) et le service était sympathique. Nous avons commandé des plats classiques, soit une entrée de egg rolls, du riz frit au poulet, du poulet aux amandes, du chow mein cantonnais, du poulet SooGuy et des côtelettes de porc à l'ail. Les portions étaient généreuses pour deux personnes (nous aurions pu être 3) et la bouffe était chaude et avait bon goût!
This place is disgusting, they are dishonest and unclean. rude service. They do not honour their promotions.

I've tried their general Tao when there's a sidewalk sale

1) It's actually pretty good
2) it's super cheap

The sushi is cheap and cheaper at 8:30 before they close. While it's not amazing,  it's on par with ayce places.
The Chinese dishes are cooked to order (mostly) and taste better than the tourist places in Chinatown. 

The interior is a reminder of how restaurants were decades ago, the booths are tiny, and you will bump knees and be much closer with your dining companions.

Ne vous faites pas prendre par l'appellation "Café", je ne vous conseille pas d'y aller dans l'intention de profiter d'un breuvage chauds caféinés à accompagner d'un croissant ou d'un biscuit aux canneberges. Ici, c'est sushi et plats asiatiques, et des bons en plus de ça! 

Les sushis sont d'une qualité étonnante, et si vous commandez après 20:30, les prix deviennent ridiculement bas. Des 2 pour 1 dans les plats genre Général tao (très bon!) et Pad Thai, et un peu plus d'une trentaine de sushi pour même pas 20$, c'est quand même vraiment dur à battre! Service de livraison, et en salle c'est un apportez votre vin. En plus, le propriétaire a ses clients à cur; la serveuse avait de la misère a lire l'image de la promotion sur notre cellulaire parce que c'était assez floue et il voulait qu'on lui montre pour qu'il puisse régler le problème, j'ai quand même trouvé ça cool.

Alors topo: Du bon pas cher, et livraison rapide si on veut manger en pantalons mous devant notre télé!

They take their reviews seriously, I see. I had complained about their bad customer service and I see that the person I dealt with no longer works there. Instead, there's a good natured employee answering everything politely. 
Food: good with decent portion sizes. 
Ambience: little shady but I have always gotten a take away. 
Service: improved. 
Price: extremely reasonable.

La force de ce restaurant, ce n'est pas sa nourriture chinoise, qui elle, est plutôt quelconque, puisqu'elle ressemble à celle que l'on voit dans tous les restaurants chinois bas de gamme. 

Non, la force de restaurant, ce sont les sushis qui sont non seulement à bon prix, mais ils sont faits sur mesure, contrairement aux autres restaurants de Sushi de l'avenue du Mont-Royal où souvent, c'est bâclé et/ou fait d'avance. Personnellement, lorsque j'y vais, je prends généralement des Dragon Eye (qui sont vraiment leur meilleur sushi), mais reste que j'aime bien varier et ils sont tous bons, peut-être pas au point du Dragon Eye, mais ils sont bons.

En gros, j'accorde trois étoiles à ce restaurant, parce qu'il y a un mélange de nourritures quelconque qui ne vaut pas plus que deux étoiles et d'excellent sushi qui lui en vaut facilement les cinq... Donc vu que le concept est un peu bordélique et qu'on n'est pas sûr si nous sommes dans un restaurant Chinois ou Japonais, j'y accorde trois étoiles tout en conseillant les fans de sushi d'y faire un tour, notamment pour le Dragon Eye.

food is mediocre, and the "vegetarian" chow mein had not only meat, but three different kinds!!! shrimp, beef and chicken, even though it was specifically listed under the vegetarian section. delivery took about an hour.

Great food however was quite disappointed when I presented the coupon that was offered on Yelp to the restaurant and they said it wasn't a valid coupon and that they didn't issue it and that they would not honour it
Doesn't taste very good, bland flavor... even the fast food chinese is better but the service was good.

Rainy awful night out and I had a craving for Chinese take away, boy do I regret that craving now. I ordered the vegetarian dinner for 1 and it seemed good on paper: egg roll, General Tao tofu, chow mein and fried rice...the only edible part was the fortune cookie. I will never, ever order from here again; the rice was tasteless, the chow mein was awful and the tofu was just plain weird, oh, and my stomach hurts.
